TableField.name: GapAnalysisItemID
TableField.phrase: Record ID|An automatically assigned number used to associate organizations with resource requirements

TableField.name: OrgGapAnalysisID
TableField.phrase: Organizational Analysis|The organizational gap analysis that includes the gap analysis item

ForeignField.name: OrganizationID
ForeignField.phrase: Organization|The name of the organization where the gap analysis is scheduled to occur

ForeignField.name: Organization
ForeignField.phrase: Organization|The name of the organization where the gap analysis is scheduled to occur

ForeignField.name: GapTitle
ForeignField.phrase: Gap Analysis Title|A short title used to identify the organizational gap analysis
ForeignField.sample: Harris Woolf Risk Control Needs Analysis

ForeignField.name: GapObjective
ForeignField.phrase: Gap Objective|A detailed description of the scope, purpose, and/or objective of the gap analysis
ForeignField.sample: XYZ Corporation needs to analyze all operational risk practices to reduce and avoid loss costs

ForeignField.name: OrganizationLiaisonID
ForeignField.phrase: Organization Liaison|The individual assigned primary accountability for organizing the gap analysis for the organization being evaluated

ForeignField.name: OrganizationLiaison
ForeignField.phrase: Organization Liaison|The individual assigned primary accountability for organizing the gap analysis for the organization being evaluated

ForeignField.name: AuditTeamLeaderID
ForeignField.phrase: Gap Team Leader|The individual assigned primary accountability for conducting the gap analysis

ForeignField.name: AuditTeamLeader
ForeignField.phrase: Gap Team Leader|The individual assigned primary accountability for conducting the gap analysis

ForeignField.name: ScheduledStart
ForeignField.phrase: Scheduled Start|The date and time the organizational gap analysis is scheduled to began

ForeignField.name: ScheduledEnd
ForeignField.phrase: Scheduled End|The date and time the organizational gap analysis is scheduled to end

ForeignField.name: ScheduledDuration
ForeignField.phrase: Scheduled Duration|The scheduled duration of the organizational gap analysis

ForeignField.name: OrgGapAnalysis
ForeignField.phrase: Organizational Analysis|The organizational gap analysis that includes the gap analysis item

RemoteField.name: GapItemContactID
RemoteField.phrase: Gap Item Contact|The individual assigned primary accountability for explaining the organization's business process

ForeignField.name: GapItemContact
ForeignField.phrase: Gap Item Contact|The individual assigned primary accountability for explaining the organization's business process

RemoteField.name: GapItemReviewerID
RemoteField.phrase: Gap Item Reviewer|The individual assigned primary accountability for conducting the gap analysis for the gap item

ForeignField.name: GapItemReviewer
ForeignField.phrase: Gap Item Reviewer|The individual assigned primary accountability for conducting the gap analysis for the gap item

TableField.name: GapAnalysisID
TableField.phrase: Analysis Item|The item to be considered for gap analysis

ForeignField.name: GapAnalysis
ForeignField.phrase: Analysis Item|The item to be considered for gap analysis
ForeignField.sample: Loss - Injury or Illness | Report or Form | OSHA 300 Log

ForeignField.name: ModuleID
ForeignField.phrase: Gap Analysis Area|The name of the risk control area or module associated with the gap analysis

ForeignField.name: Module
ForeignField.phrase: Gap Analysis Area|The name of the the risk control area or module associated with the gap analysis

ForeignField.name: AnalysisTypeID
ForeignField.phrase: Analysis Type|The specific type of gap analysis performed

CodeField.name: AnalysisType
CodeField.phrase: Analysis Type|The specific type of gap analysis performed

ForeignField.name: AnalysisItem
ForeignField.phrase: Analysis Item|A brief title used to identify the item being analyzed for gaps

ForeignField.name: AnalysisDescription
ForeignField.phrase: Analysis Description|A more detailed description of the item to be analyzed for gaps
ForeignField.sample: Federal OSHA requires all companies to maintain OSHA 300 logs of recordable injuries and the logs must be current within five days

TableField.name: OrganizationDescription
TableField.phrase: Organization Description|A detailed description of the businees process employed by the organization
TableField.sample: XYZ Corporation uses a clerk to maintain the OSHA 300 Log. They update the log when corporate requests information.

ForeignField.name: KeyResources
ForeignField.phrase: Key Resources|A list of key human resources and/or job titles likely to be of assistance when analyzing for gaps in the business process
ForeignField.sample: Human Resources Manager, Safety Coordinator or Director

TableField.name: OrganizationResources
TableField.phrase: Organization Resources|A list of human resources assisting with the gap analysis for the business process
TableField.sample: Sue Blue, Human Resources Manager; Ted Red, Safety Coordinator

ForeignField.name: KeyLocations
ForeignField.phrase: Key Locations|A list of key locations where business processes occur, process materials are maintained, or processes can be evaluated
ForeignField.sample: Safety Director's office, Human resource director's office

TableField.name: OrganizationLocations
TableField.phrase: Organization Locations|A list of locations where business processes were evaluated

ForeignField.name: KeyRisks
ForeignField.phrase: Key Risks|A brief description of the key risks associated with failure to manage or repair gaps in the business process

TableField.name: OrganizationRisks
TableField.phrase: Organization Risks|A description of key organizational risks identified in association with the gap analysis
TableField.sample: The organization is at risk of receiving a fine for failure to comply with OSHA Standards

ForeignField.name: MethodsandBenefits
ForeignField.phrase: Methods and Benefits|A brief description of the methods used by Active Agenda to address the operational risk requirement and the resulting benefits
ForeignField.sample: Active Agenda automates data collection and reporting on the OSHA 300 Log.

RemoteField.name: LikelihoodID
RemoteField.phrase: Risk Likelihood|A description of the risk likelihood based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Likelihoods module

ForeignField.name: LikelihoodValue
ForeignField.phrase: Likelihood Value|A numerical value assigned to the likelihood of risk occurrence. The likelihood value is used in combination with the severity value to calculate a risk index score and an associated recommendation to mitigate the risk

ForeignField.name: RiskLikelihoodTerm
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Likelihood Term|A one word description of the risk likelihood level

ForeignField.name: Likelihood
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Likelihood|A description of the risk likelihood based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Likelihoods module

RemoteField.name: LikelihoodStatusID
RemoteField.phrase: Likelihood Status|The present status of efforts to resolve the likelihood that this risk will occur, continue, or repeat

CodeField.name: LikelihoodStatus
CodeField.phrase: Likelihood Status|The present status of efforts to resolve the likelihood that this risk will occur, continue, or repeat

RemoteField.name: LikelihoodFactors
RemoteField.phrase: Likelihood Factors|A detailed description of the factors affecting the likelihood that this risk will occur, continue, or repeat
RemoteField.sample: SCBAs were purchased for all First Responders and all responders have been trained by the Fire Department

RemoteField.name: SeverityID
RemoteField.phrase: Risk Severity|A description of the risk severity based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Severities module

ForeignField.name: SeverityValue
ForeignField.phrase: Severity Value|A numerical value assigned to the severity of risk or loss. The severity value is used in combination with the likelihood value to calculate a risk index score and an associated recommendation to mitigate the risk of loss

ForeignField.name: RiskSeverityTerm
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Severity Term|A one word description of the risk severity level

ForeignField.name: Severity
ForeignField.phrase: Risk Severity|A description of the risk severity based on a combination of field values assigned from within the Risk Severities module
ForeignField.sample: SLIGHT: Minor First Aid Injury; 900.00 to 9,000.00

CalculatedField.name: TotalCost
CalculatedField.phrase: Total Cost|The automatically calculated cost associated with this gap anlayis item. This field is used to calculate the calculated severity and in the instance of the gap analysis items the field calculates total estimated costs and does not include actual costs

RangeField.name: CostSeverityID
RangeField.phrase: Cost Severity|An automatically calculated severity category, based on the threshold values for Severity

ForeignField.name: CostSeverityValue
ForeignField.phrase: Cost Severity|An automatically calculated severity category, based on the threshold values for Severity

ForeignField.name: CostSeverity
ForeignField.phrase: Cost Severity|An automatically calculated severity category, based on the threshold values for Severity

RemoteField.name: CachedTotalCost
RemoteField.phrase: Total Cost|The total cost of this incident

CalculatedField.name: CalculatedSeverityValue
CalculatedField.phrase: Calculated Severity Value|The greater of the User-assigned severity value and the acutomaticlly assigned Cost Severity value

CalculatedField.name: IndexValue
CalculatedField.phrase: Index Value|A calculated field based on the risk likelihood and risk severity. The resulting risk index value is compared against the assigned risk index recommendations entered into the Risk Index module and the respective recommendation is displayed

RangeField.name: RiskRecommendation
RangeField.phrase: Recommended Action|An automatically assigned recommendation, based on the values assigned for Likelihood and Severity
RangeField.sample: Take action if and when appropriate

TableField.name: AnalysisStartTime
TableField.phrase: Start Time|Time the gap analysis began

TableField.name: AnalysisEndTime
TableField.phrase: End Time|Time this gap analysis ended

ForeignField.name: HoursEstimate
ForeignField.phrase: Estimate (hours)|The number of hours estimated to analyze gaps in the business process

CalculatedField.name: HoursActual
CalculatedField.phrase: Actual Hours|The actual number of hours required to to conduct the analysis for the gap item

TableField.name: ReviewStatusID
TableField.phrase: Review Status|The current status of the gap analysis item review

CodeField.name: ReviewStatus
CodeField.phrase: Review Status|The current status of the gap analysis item review

SummaryField.name: TotalEstExp
SummaryField.phrase: Estimated Exposure|The total estimated cost exposure associated with the gap analysis item

SummaryField.name: TotalEstOpp
SummaryField.phrase: Estimated Opportunity|The total estimated financial opportunity associated with the gap analysis item

CombinedField.name: RecordLabel
CombinedField.phrase: Record Label|The short, concise, label of the record for display purposes
CombinedField.sample: Active Agenda, Inc. | Loss - Injury or Illness | Report or Form | OSHA 300 Log

CombinedField.name: GapAnalysisItem
CombinedField.phrase: Gap Analysis Item|A combined field used to describe the organizational gap analysis item when associating it with other records
CombinedField.sample: Active Agenda, Inc. | Loss - Injury or Illness | Report or Form | OSHA 300 Log

SampleItem.name: LOW: Possible but unlikely to occur
PROBABLE: Very likely to occur in immediate future
SLIGHT: Minor First Aid Injury; 900.00 to 9,000.00
SERIOUS: Serious injury or illness; 9001.00 to 90,000.00
SEVERE: Death or disabling injury; 90,001.00 to 900,000.00
CATASTROPHIC: Deaths and/or disabling injuries; 900,001.00 to 1,000,000.00

DocumentationSection.title: Introduction
DocumentationSection.p: The installation-specific introduction to the scope and purpose of this module should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said to introduce this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: Implementation
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific implementation rules, policies, practices should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about implementating this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: People Elements
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific information regarding the way this module impacts people should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about how this module impacts, or is impacted by, people in general. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: Barriers to success
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific barriers to success in implemeting this module should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about barriers to success associated with the subject matter of this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific data collection methods, locations, and resources should be entered here. DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific questions that are frequently asked of administrators or implementers should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see the types of questions collected, and answers provided, by the Active Agenda community relating to the subject matter of this module.
